title: Chris Shea joins Outlook/PostEverything team as an editor
title_page: Chris Shea joins Outlook/PostEverything team as an editor - The Washington Post
text:
Announcement from Outlook Editor Adam Kushner and Outlook Deputy Editor/PostEverything Editor Mike Madden:
We’re delighted to report that Chris Shea will become an editor on the Outlook/PostEverything team.
As a senior editor at Vox, Chris supervises the Perspectives section, which includes Vox’s outside opinion pieces and first-person essays. The section has published important stories about the legal and political battles over health care policy, the #MeToo movement, and the origins of support for Trump and the future of the Democratic Party.
Over his career, Chris has written for dozens of newspapers and magazines. He wrote a column about intellectual trends for the Boston Globe’s Ideas section and has been a blogger and columnist for the Wall Street Journal’s Review section. He started his career at the Chronicle of Higher Education, where he remained a contributor for many years, and has also worked at NPR, Lingua Franca, and Bloggingheads.tv. His journalism has won a number of awards, including several from the Education Writers Association.
Chris lives in Hyattsville, MD, where he occasionally coaches his son’s sports teams (soccer, baseball, basketball) and volunteers as a tutor at Hyattsville Elementary School. He is a graduate of Princeton University.
Chris begins on August 27. Please join us in welcoming him.
